text: alpha-Tocopheryl succinate inhibits monocytic cell adhesion to endothelial cells by suppressing NF-kappa B mobilization .
The adherence of monocytes to activated endothelium is an early event in atherogenesis .

Because antioxidants have been considered to be of antiatherosclerotic potential , we investigated the effects of alpha-tocopherol ( TCP ) and its acetate and succinate esters on monocyte adhesion to cytokine - stimulated human umbilical vein endothelial cells ( HUVEC ) .

Endothelial cells were treated with TCP , alpha-tocopherol acetate ( TCP acetate ) , or alpha-tocopheryl succinate ( TCP succinate ) before stimulation with <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; 10 U / ml , 6 h ) or <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; 10 U / ml , 6 h ) .

Cytokine - stimulated cell surface expression of <extra_id_0> vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD106 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ELAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD62E <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , but not of <extra_id_0> intercellular adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD54 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , was time - and dose-dependently inhibited by TCP succinate but not by TCP or TCP acetate .

text: TCP succinate ( 200 microM , 24 h ) reduced TNF - induced <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression from a specific mean fluorescence intensity of 151 +/- 28 to 12 +/- 4 channels and from 225 +/- 38 to 79 +/- 21 channels , respectively .

text: Decreased adhesion molecule expression was associated with a reduction of monocytic cell adhesion .

TCP succinate ( 20 microM , 72 h ) , but not TCP ( 200 microM , 72 h ) , reduced U-937 cell adhesion to <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated ( 10 U / ml , 6 h ) HUVEC by 30 % ( P < 0.025 ) and to <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated HUVEC by 56 % ( P < 0.010 ) .

Electrophoretic mobility-shift assays of HUVEC nuclear proteins revealed a decrease in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) activation after pretreatment of HUVEC with TCP succinate but not with TCP , TCP acetate , or succinate alone .

In conclusion , we demonstrate that the vitamin E derivative TCP succinate prevents monocytic cell adhesion to cytokine - stimulated endothelial cells by inhibiting the activation of NF-kappa B , further emphasizing the antiatherosclerotic potential of lipid soluble antioxidants .
